body_html:
Ah yes!! I'll post a snippet of a part of the code that kept throwing the error as i changed it
So basically the errors kept popping up the minute i change the stride of my convolutional layer from (2,2)
to (1,1)
I'm also posting a snippet of my network

# The first three convolutional + maxpooling layers
neural_net = conv2d_maxpool(x, 32, (5,5), (1,1), (2,2), (1,1))
neural_net = conv2d_maxpool(neural_net, 64, (1,1), (2,2), (4,4), (2,2))
neural_net = conv2d_maxpool(neural_net, 64, (2,2), (1,1), (2,2), (1,1))
neural_net = conv2d_maxpool(neural_net, 128, (2,2), (1,1), (2,2), (1,1))

# Layer to flatten the tensor from the convolutional layers
neural_net = flatten(neural_net)

# Two fully connected layers with dropout
neural_net = fully_conn(neural_net, 2304)
neural_net = tf.nn.dropout(neural_net, keep_prob)
neural_net = fully_conn(neural_net, 1152)
neural_net = tf.nn.dropout(neural_net, keep_prob)
neural_net = fully_conn(neural_net, 576)

# Layer for output
neural_net = output(neural_net, 7)

Here i have defined custom wrappers for each layer ..which you can find in my repo

Ah yes!! I'll post a snippet of a part of the code that kept throwing the error as i changed it
So basically the errors kept popping up the minute i change the stride of my convolutional layer from (2,2)
to (1,1)
I'm also posting a snippet of my network
# The first three convolutional + maxpooling layers
neural_net = conv2d_maxpool(x, 32, (5,5), (1,1), (2,2), (1,1))
neural_net = conv2d_maxpool(neural_net, 64, (1,1), (2,2), (4,4), (2,2))
neural_net = conv2d_maxpool(neural_net, 64, (2,2), (1,1), (2,2), (1,1))
neural_net = conv2d_maxpool(neural_net, 128, (2,2), (1,1), (2,2), (1,1))

# Layer to flatten the tensor from the convolutional layers
neural_net = flatten(neural_net)

# Two fully connected layers with dropout
neural_net = fully_conn(neural_net, 2304)
neural_net = tf.nn.dropout(neural_net, keep_prob)
neural_net = fully_conn(neural_net, 1152)
neural_net = tf.nn.dropout(neural_net, keep_prob)
neural_net = fully_conn(neural_net, 576)

# Layer for output
neural_net = output(neural_net, 7)

Here i have defined  custom wrappers for each layer ..which you can find in my repo
body:
Ah yes!! I'll post a snippet of a part of the code that kept throwing the error as i changed it 
So basically the errors kept popping up the minute i change the stride of my convolutional layer from (2,2)
to (1,1)
I'm also posting a snippet of my network

    # The first three convolutional + maxpooling layers
    neural_net = conv2d_maxpool(x, 32, (5,5), (1,1), (2,2), (1,1))
    neural_net = conv2d_maxpool(neural_net, 64, (1,1), (2,2), (4,4), (2,2))
    neural_net = conv2d_maxpool(neural_net, 64, (2,2), (1,1), (2,2), (1,1))
    neural_net = conv2d_maxpool(neural_net, 128, (2,2), (1,1), (2,2), (1,1))

    # Layer to flatten the tensor from the convolutional layers
    neural_net = flatten(neural_net)
    
    # Two fully connected layers with dropout
    neural_net = fully_conn(neural_net, 2304)
    neural_net = tf.nn.dropout(neural_net, keep_prob)
    neural_net = fully_conn(neural_net, 1152)
    neural_net = tf.nn.dropout(neural_net, keep_prob)
    neural_net = fully_conn(neural_net, 576)
    
    # Layer for output
    neural_net = output(neural_net, 7)

Here i have defined  custom wrappers for each layer ..which you can find in my repo
